Ori and the Blind Forest was a massively refreshing - not just platformer - but game in general. This takes the cake as best platformer that I have ever played, and also very high up in ranks with any genre.

This game took me straight back to childhood memories playing games like Spyro or Rayman. With mystical, whimsical magic, and tones of positivity with a clear 'villain'. The art was beautiful. The gameplay was addicting, as I beat this game in 3 days and played 17 hours.

I give one point less than it deserves, sadly. Partly for a technical bug of not being able to unlock some achievements that I clearly should have. (killing 3 enemies while not touching the ground, an easy task in this game...) -And partly because I believe Ori's character development compared to the other characters was lacking. As Ori is the main character, you would think that we'd have a little more substance than: born of the tree spirit, has a friend, and must save the forest because Ori is the offspring of the tree spirit. Surprisingly doesn't make much difference, so a 9/10 is still solid.

This game brought me joy to play! Awesome game!

I am pleasantly surprised at how good this game is. With a completion rate of 90% and ~7 hours of game play, it is shorter than other metroidvania games that I've played. With that said, it's a great experience that you can tell had a ton of time and effort poured into it. As with similar metroidvania style games, it can be mildly frustrating when you start off with no special abilities, but you quickly gain access to pretty fun movement options. 

The game isn't actually all that difficult (based off the default 'normal' difficulty), and there are no typical boss fights (except a few little rooms that have a couple enemies to kill.) Instead, there are a lot of fun chase scenes that play off moves you were unwittingly practicing in the areas just prior to them. 

Think of it like a casual metroidvania with a very cute story.
This game is great, the story is good and the game itself is the right amount of challenging and fun!

Such a phenomenal games from start to finish. Normally I'm not a big fan of metroidvania type games, bit this one does it in a way that is pretty easy to follow and organically. The adventure is brimming with beautiful visuals and art design, Music that heals the soul, and a world so lush and big. The level design was is one of the best I have ever seen in a video game. It's like designed in a realistic way in a forest setting while also providing growth and challenge in the world and move set. 

Ori Controls fantastically and the move set provided is fun to play with  and naturally learn how to use the best out of every tool you have. 

I would recommend this game to anyone that truly wants a rich, atmosphere experience. It's also pretty challenging to recommend to those who may want some challenge to overcome. Easily in my top 20 games of all time.

Altogether, absolutely amazing game. Beautiful story and amazing soundtrack. Love the visuals and animations. Aside from Hollow Knight a few months ago, platformers are new for me and this was a satisfyingly fun yet sometimes challenging game. The game starts off manageable and I felt my progression all the way through. 

Many moments of frustration against an environment or enemy that I'd eventually overcome and coming back hours later and now it's so much easier - showing how you have evolved and gotten better. Yet the game kept me humble because while you're better, you're still a squishy small creature that can't power through everything. You have to learn, adapt, and overcome, always facing new situations. Arguably my favorite screenshot will be me gliding down a lava chamber while two enemies fire lasers that will instakill me if they hit me, and then compare that to the quiet, cute start at the very beginning. 

Honestly shed a small tear at the very end and thought what a beautiful game. Very happy to have picked it up after waiting a few months to play it, and really looking forward to playing the sequel,

As a miscellaneous end note, for anyone that loves the soundtrack, spotify has it on there and likely other music apps too! And the "theater" mode is so, so cool to see just how different some of the development vs end product is. The final product has amazing visuals and it's so cool to recognize features that existed in development that lasted to the final game and also see all the stuff that did not make it.

And some meta data: I had 9.8 hours when I finished the story and exactly 600 deaths.

Still one of my favorite platformers of all time. Felt nice to revisit it in the form of the definitive edition. The extra difficulty settings along with the new zone are a nice welcome. Would recommend this to anybody looking to revisit an incredible game from last gen - or anyone seeking fun addictive adventure for the first time!

What a beautiful game! Platforming is challenging but the incredible soundtrack is what motivates me to keep trying when I get stuck. Some of it is so serene it relieves my anxiety! The story gets me so emotional like there were a few times where I either gasped or cried when I got to a certain moment. The graphics are gorgeous like they were painted from scratch, and unlike most Metroidvania games I've played, it's not very long but it was completely worth my time.

Why is this game good? 
The mechanics and gameplay is challenging but fun
The story is interesting but vague at times which fits the entire style of the game
The combat and chase scenes are very good despite enemies respawning very quickly. 

How does this game fall?
It's difficult to get into it at first. If your not a curious type of person or do not like slow paced beginnings then it might pose a challenge to get into it. However once you do it's great. 
It's difficult I found myself occasionally rage quitting at some chase scenes. Maybe just don't play on Hard difficulty stick to normal to reduce rage. 

Is it worth the money?
Yes

It it worth your time? 
Mostly

Is it worth the effort? 
Negotiable

Should you buy it? 
Only if you are interested

I don't like the combat but the platforming was amazing. The escape when the water was flowing after removing the infection was amazing.

So far this game is up there with my two favourite metroidvanias which is rather impressive (Blasphemous & Hollow Knight). The world itself is just so immersive and full or charm it's hard not to lose track of time and want to explore absolutely every corner and secret. I believe I am almost done so it is on the shorter side compared to Hollow but it doesn't feel like it is over staying it's welcome and is a very tight quality package. I would recommend to those who love metroidvanias, unique artstyles and 2D platformers. I haven't finished yet but it's a solid 8.5/10 for me at this point in time with the possibility to rise depending on the ending.
